template.name: Template App LVM active
template.description: Application template for monitoring Linux Logical Volumen Management (LVM)

discovery_rule.name: LVM logical linear volumes discovery
discovery_rule.description:
Low-Level discovery of linear LVM logical volumes (LV)
Returns the following macros for each available LV: * `{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}` * Logical volume full name (`lvs -o lv_full_name`) * Example: `vg_example_01/lv_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_UUID}` * Logical volume UUID (`lvs -o lv_uuid`) * Example. `dxi5Hw-Xo2m-SAVi-ypZh-QO4I-krpI-sR3N67` * `{#LVM_LV_TYPE}` * Logical volume segment type (`lvs -o segtype`) * Example: `linear`, `thin`, `thin-pool` * `{#LVM_LV_ROLE}` * Logical volume role (`lvs -o lv_role`) * Example: `public`, `private`, `public,snapshot,thicksnapshot` * `{#LVM_LV_NAME}` * Logical volume name (`lvs -o lv_name`) * Example: `lv_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_VG_NAME}` * Volume group name (`lvs -o vg_name`) * Example: `vg_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_PATH}` * Full pathname for LV. Blank for internal LVs. (`lvs -o lv_path`) * Example: `/dev/vg_example_01/lv_example_01`

item_prototype.name: LVM {#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} Read:Merged
item_prototype.description: Field #5 Number of reads merged. Reads and writes which are adjacent to each other may be merged for efficiency. Thus two 4K reads may become one 8K read before it is ultimately handed to the disk, and so it will be counted (and queued) as only one I/O. This field lets you know how often this was done.

item_prototype.name: LVM {#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} Write:Merged
item_prototype.description: Field #9 Number of writes merged. Reads and writes which are adjacent to each other may be merged for efficiency. Thus two 4K reads may become one 8K read before it is ultimately handed to the disk, and so it will be counted (and queued) as only one I/O. This field lets you know how often this was done.

item_prototype.name: Active state of $3 LV $1
item_prototype.description: Active state of an linear LVM logical volume (LV).

item_prototype.name: Size of $3 LV $1
item_prototype.description: The size of a linear LVM logical volume (LV).

trigger_prototype.name: LVM linear LV {#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} is not active ({ITEM.VALUE1}) on {HOSTNAME}
trigger_prototype.description: The linear LVM logical volume is not in state "active", which is most likely a sign of a problem.

discovery_rule.name: LVM logical thick snapshot volumes discovery
discovery_rule.description:
Low-Level discovery of a thick provisioned snapshot LVM logical volumes (LV)
Returns the following macros for each available LV: * `{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}` * Logical volume full name (`lvs -o lv_full_name`) * Example: `vg_example_01/lv_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_UUID}` * Logical volume UUID (`lvs -o lv_uuid`) * Example. `dxi5Hw-Xo2m-SAVi-ypZh-QO4I-krpI-sR3N67` * `{#LVM_LV_TYPE}` * Logical volume segment type (`lvs -o segtype`) * Example: `linear`, `thin`, `thin-pool` * `{#LVM_LV_ROLE}` * Logical volume role (`lvs -o lv_role`) * Example: `public`, `private`, `public,snapshot,thicksnapshot` * `{#LVM_LV_NAME}` * Logical volume name (`lvs -o lv_name`) * Example: `lv_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_VG_NAME}` * Volume group name (`lvs -o vg_name`) * Example: `vg_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_PATH}` * Full pathname for LV. Blank for internal LVs. (`lvs -o lv_path`) * Example: `/dev/vg_example_01/lv_example_01`

item_prototype.name: Active state of $3 LV $1
item_prototype.description: Active state of a thick provisioned LVM snapshot.

item_prototype.name: Size of $3 LV $1
item_prototype.description: The size of a thick provisioned snapshot LVM logical volume (LV).

item_prototype.name: Origin of $3 LV $1
item_prototype.description: Origin device of a thick provisioned LVM snapshot.

item_prototype.name: Free snapshot data of $3 LV $1
item_prototype.description: The free snapshot data of a thick provisioned LVM snapshot in bytes.

item_prototype.name: Free snapshot data of $3 LV $1 in %
item_prototype.description: The percentage of free snapshot data of a thick provisioned LVM snapshot.

item_prototype.name: Allocated snapshot data of $3 LV $1 in %
item_prototype.description: The percentage of allocated snapshot data of a thick provisioned LVM snapshot in bytes.

item_prototype.name: Allocated snapshot data of $3 LV $1
item_prototype.description: The allocated snapshot data of a thick provisioned LVM snapshot in bytes.

trigger_prototype.name: LVM thick snapshot allocation {HOST.NAME}:[{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} is high (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} free)
trigger_prototype.description: The free snapshot data of the LVM thick provisioned snapshot is below `{$LVM_LV_SNAPSHOT_DATA_FREE_WARNING_THRESHOLD:"{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}"}` and `{$LVM_LV_SNAPSHOT_DATA_PFREE_WARNING_THRESHOLD:"{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}"}` percent. The snapshot will turn invalid soon.

dependency.name: LVM thick snapshot allocation {HOST.NAME}:[{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} is very high (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} free)

trigger_prototype.name: LVM thick snapshot allocation {HOST.NAME}:[{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} is very high (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} free)
trigger_prototype.description: The free snapshot data of the LVM thick provisioned snapshot is below `{$LVM_LV_SNAPSHOT_DATA_FREE_HIGH_THRESHOLD:"{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}"}` and `{$LVM_LV_SNAPSHOT_DATA_PFREE_HIGH_THRESHOLD:"{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}"}` percent. The snapshot will turn invalid very soon.

trigger_prototype.name: LVM thick snapshot LV {#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} is not active ({ITEM.VALUE1}) on {HOSTNAME}
trigger_prototype.description: The thick provisioned LVM snapshot is not in state "active", which is most likely a sign of a problem.

graph_prototype.name: LVM usage of thick provisioned snapshot LV {#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}
LVM usage of thick provisioned snapshot LV {#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} in %

discovery_rule.name: LVM logical thin-pool volumes discovery
discovery_rule.description:
Low-Level discovery of thin-pool LVM logical volumes (LV)
Returns the following macros for each available LV: * `{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}` * Logical volume full name (`lvs -o lv_full_name`) * Example: `vg_example_01/lv_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_UUID}` * Logical volume UUID (`lvs -o lv_uuid`) * Example. `dxi5Hw-Xo2m-SAVi-ypZh-QO4I-krpI-sR3N67` * `{#LVM_LV_TYPE}` * Logical volume segment type (`lvs -o segtype`) * Example: `linear`, `thin`, `thin-pool` * `{#LVM_LV_ROLE}` * Logical volume role (`lvs -o lv_role`) * Example: `public`, `private`, `public,snapshot,thicksnapshot` * `{#LVM_LV_NAME}` * Logical volume name (`lvs -o lv_name`) * Example: `lv_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_VG_NAME}` * Volume group name (`lvs -o vg_name`) * Example: `vg_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_PATH}` * Full pathname for LV. Blank for internal LVs. (`lvs -o lv_path`) * Example: `/dev/vg_example_01/lv_example_01`

item_prototype.description: The free pool data of a thin-pool LVM logical volume (LV) in bytes.

item_prototype.description: The percentage of free pool data of a thin-pool LVM logical volume (LV).

item_prototype.name: Allocated pool data of $3 LV $1 in %
item_prototype.description: The percentage of allocated data of a thin-pool LVM logical volume (LV).

item_prototype.description: The allocated pool data of a thin-pool LVM logical volume (LV) in bytes.

item_prototype.description: Active state of a thin-pool LVM logical volume (LV).

item_prototype.name: Metadata size of $3 LV $1
item_prototype.description: The size of the LV that holds the metadata of a thin-pool LVM logical volume (LV).

item_prototype.name: Size of $3 LV $1
item_prototype.description: The size of a thin-pool LVM logical volume (LV).

item_prototype.name: Full behavior of $3 LV $1
item_prototype.description: The behaviour of thin-pool LVM logical volume (LV) when full.

item_prototype.name: Free meta data of $3 LV $1
item_prototype.description: The free meta data of a thin-pool LVM logical volume (LV) in bytes.

item_prototype.name: Free meta data of $3 LV $1 in %
item_prototype.description: The percentage of free metadata of a thin-pool LVM logical volume (LV).

item_prototype.name: Allocated meta data of $3 LV $1 in %
item_prototype.description: The percentage of allocated metadata of a thin-pool LVM logical volume (LV).

item_prototype.name: Allocated meta data of $3 LV $1
item_prototype.description: The allocated meta data of a thin-pool LVM logical volume (LV) in bytes.

item_prototype.name: Number of thin volumes in $3 LV $1
item_prototype.description: The number of thin volumes in this pool.

trigger_prototype.name: LVM thin-pool free meta data on {HOST.NAME}:[{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} is low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} free)
trigger_prototype.description: The free meta data of the LVM thin-pool is below `{$LVM_LV_META_DATA_FREE_WARNING_THRESHOLD:"{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}"} ` and `{$LVM_LV_META_DATA_PFREE_WARNING_THRESHOLD:"{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}"}` percent.

dependency.name: LVM thin-pool free meta data on {HOST.NAME}:[{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} is very low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} free)

trigger_prototype.name: LVM thin-pool free meta data on {HOST.NAME}:[{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} is very low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} free)
trigger_prototype.description: The free meta data of the LVM thin-pool is below `{$LVM_LV_META_DATA_FREE_HIGH_THRESHOLD:"{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}"} ` and `{$LVM_LV_META_DATA_PFREE_HIGH_THRESHOLD:"{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}"}` percent.

trigger_prototype.name: LVM thin-pool free pool data on {HOST.NAME}:[{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} is low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} free)
trigger_prototype.description: The free pool data of the LVM thin-pool is below `{$LVM_LV_POOL_DATA_FREE_WARNING_THRESHOLD:"{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}"} ` and `{$LVM_LV_POOL_DATA_PFREE_WARNING_THRESHOLD:"{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}"}` percent.

dependency.name: LVM thin-pool free pool data on {HOST.NAME}:[{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} is very low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} free)

trigger_prototype.name: LVM thin-pool free pool data on {HOST.NAME}:[{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} is very low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} free)
trigger_prototype.description: The free pool data of the LVM thin-pool is below `{$LVM_LV_POOL_DATA_FREE_HIGH_THRESHOLD:"{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}"} ` and `{$LVM_LV_POOL_DATA_PFREE_HIGH_THRESHOLD:"{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}"}` percent.

trigger_prototype.name: LVM thin-pool LV {#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME} is not active ({ITEM.VALUE1}) on {HOSTNAME}
trigger_prototype.description: The thin-pool LVM logical volume is not in state "active", which is most likely a sign of a problem.

discovery_rule.name: LVM logical thin snapshot volumes discovery
discovery_rule.description:
Low-Level discovery of a thin provisioned snapshot LVM logical volumes (LV)
Returns the following macros for each available LV: * `{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}` * Logical volume full name (`lvs -o lv_full_name`) * Example: `vg_example_01/lv_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_UUID}` * Logical volume UUID (`lvs -o lv_uuid`) * Example. `dxi5Hw-Xo2m-SAVi-ypZh-QO4I-krpI-sR3N67` * `{#LVM_LV_TYPE}` * Logical volume segment type (`lvs -o segtype`) * Example: `linear`, `thin`, `thin-pool` * `{#LVM_LV_ROLE}` * Logical volume role (`lvs -o lv_role`) * Example: `public`, `private`, `public,snapshot,thicksnapshot` * `{#LVM_LV_NAME}` * Logical volume name (`lvs -o lv_name`) * Example: `lv_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_VG_NAME}` * Volume group name (`lvs -o vg_name`) * Example: `vg_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_PATH}` * Full pathname for LV. Blank for internal LVs. (`lvs -o lv_path`) * Example: `/dev/vg_example_01/lv_example_01`

discovery_rule.name: LVM logical thin volumes discovery
discovery_rule.description:
Low-Level discovery of thin LVM logical volumes (LV)
Returns the following macros for each available LV: * `{#LVM_LV_FULL_NAME}` * Logical volume full name (`lvs -o lv_full_name`) * Example: `vg_example_01/lv_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_UUID}` * Logical volume UUID (`lvs -o lv_uuid`) * Example. `dxi5Hw-Xo2m-SAVi-ypZh-QO4I-krpI-sR3N67` * `{#LVM_LV_TYPE}` * Logical volume segment type (`lvs -o segtype`) * Example: `linear`, `thin`, `thin-pool` * `{#LVM_LV_ROLE}` * Logical volume role (`lvs -o lv_role`) * Example: `public`, `private`, `public,snapshot,thicksnapshot` * `{#LVM_LV_NAME}` * Logical volume name (`lvs -o lv_name`) * Example: `lv_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_VG_NAME}` * Volume group name (`lvs -o vg_name`) * Example: `vg_example_01` * `{#LVM_LV_PATH}` * Full pathname for LV. Blank for internal LVs. (`lvs -o lv_path`) * Example: `/dev/vg_example_01/lv_example_01`

discovery_rule.name: LVM physical volumes discovery
discovery_rule.description:
Low-Level discovery of LVM physical volumes (PV)
Returns the following macros for each available PV: * `{#LVM_PV_NAME}` * Physical volume name (`pvs -o pv_name`) * Example: `/dev/sda` * `{#LVM_PV_UUID}` * Physical volume UUID (`pvs -o pv_uuid`) * Example. `S1qfoV-Jbmw-qjqH-koz3-HEyh-eNme-eHlBe8` * `{#LVM_PV_TYPE}` * Physical volume metadata type (`pvs -o pv_fmt`) * Example: `lvm2`

item_prototype.name: Underlying device size of PV $1
item_prototype.description: The size of the underlying device of an LVM physical volume (PV).

item_prototype.name: Unallocated space on PV $1
item_prototype.description: Unallocated (free) space on an LVM physical volume (PV).

item_prototype.name: Size of PV $1
item_prototype.description: The size of an LVM physical volume (PV).

item_prototype.name: Allocated space on PV $1
item_prototype.description: Allocated (used) space on an LVM physical volume (PV).

discovery_rule.name: LVM volume groups discovery
discovery_rule.description:
Low-Level discovery of LVM volume groups (VG)
Returns the following macros for each available PV: * `{#LVM_VG_NAME}` * Volume group name (`vgs -o vg_name`) * Example: `vg_example_01` * `{#LVM_VG_UUID}` * Volume group name (`vgs -o vg_uuid`) * Example. `s83QZR-w6c4-Ngqk-u1fM-STAl-evYq-MLxiN0` * `{#LVM_VG_TYPE}` * Volume group metadata type (`vgs -o vg_fmt`) * Example: `lvm2`

item_prototype.name: Number of LVs on VG $1
item_prototype.description: Number of logical volumes (LVs) on an LVM volume group (VG).

item_prototype.name: Number of PVs on VG $1
item_prototype.description: Number of physical volumes (PVs) belonging to an LVM volume group (VG).

item_prototype.name: Number of Snapshots on VG $1
item_prototype.description: Number of snapshots on an LVM volume group (VG).

item_prototype.name: Free space on VG $1
item_prototype.description: Amount of free space of an LVM volume group (VG).

item_prototype.name: Number of missing PVs in VG $1
item_prototype.description: Number of missing physical volumes (PVs) on an LVM volume group (VG).

item_prototype.name: Size of VG $1
item_prototype.description: The size of an LVM volume group (VG).

item_prototype.name: Used space on VG $1
item_prototype.description: Amount of used space of an LVM volume group (VG).

trigger_prototype.name: {ITEM.VALUE1} LVM PVs missing on {HOST.NAME}:[{#LVM_VG_NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: The LVM volume group misses one ore more physical volumes.

graph_prototype.name: LVM LVs and snapshots on VG {#LVM_VG_NAME}
